name: Zero Frame
description:
Zero Frame

Easily work with zero frames in Figma with.


Add zero frame: Add a zero frame to selected frames and auto layouts, or if nothing is selected, the canvas.


Convert to zero frame: Convert selected frames and auto layouts to zero frames. Auto layouts retain their positioning properties.


Wrap in zero frame: Wrap selected layers in a zero frame.


What and Why?

A zero frame is a frame with either zero height or width. It occupies no space on the canvas but can contain and position layers within it.


They can be used to add layers to AutoLayout with absolute positioning, i.e. they are not affected by the stacking order of other layers, but still retain the auto-sizing behavior of AutoLayout. It can be used in a number of ways, some of which are described in this great talk from Figma Config 2021 - Pushing Figma to its limits with Chudo, Andrei, Gleb, Vitalii, Shuaiqi.


Open Source

Zero Frame is open source and contributions are welcome.
